newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's CNMV opens insider trading probe of BBV.
newsitem.headline: Spain's CNMV opens insider trading probe of BBV.

text.p: Spain's Stock Market Commission CNMV said on Friday it had opened an insider trading investigation into Banco Bilbao Vizcaya.

In a statement, the CNMV said it had opened the probe "because there was evidence the procedures and norms required (by the law) with respect to the establishing of information barriers among different functions and departments had not been applied."
The probe stems from a BBV purchase of shares in Sevillana de Electricidad during Endesa's buyout of Sevillana late last year.

"Lack of compliance with these procedures and norms prompted BBV to order the purchase, through a foreign intermediary, shares of Sevillana de Electricidad SA in supposed violation of is obligation to keep such information in reserve," the CNMV statement said.
The operation brought the bank gross earnings of 35 million pesetas.
The probe also includes Javier Echenique, a director general of BBV, the CNMV said.
